citation.article-title: Flexibacter maritimus sp. nov., a pathogen of marine fishes

p.s: Description of Flexibacter maritimus sp. nov.
Flexibacter maritimus (mar'i.ti.mus. L. adj. maritimus living near the sea)
The characteristics of type strain R2 (= NCMB 2514) are listed in Table 2.
Lysis of dead cells of Escherichia coli is negative.
Seawater, at least one-third strength, is required for growth.
Alternatively, not only NaCl but also KCl is required.
G + C content of DNA ranges from 31.3 to 32.5 mol%; for the type strain, this value is 31.6 mol%.
Source of type strain: isolated in 1977 from a diseased fingerling red sea bream (P. major) reared in a floating net cage offshore Ondo, Hiroshima Prefecture, Japan.
One additional strain of F . maritimus, B2, has been deposited in the National Collection of Marine Bacteria as NCMB 2513.
